articles.title: Mandatory gold hallmarking from June 1: What you should know - CNBCTV18
articles.description: As per the new rules, if jewelry or an artifact made of 14, 18, or 22-carat gold is sold without the BIS hallmark, the jeweler could be penalised five times the cost of the object or imprisoned for up to one year.Get latest Business online at cnbctv18.com
articles.content:
In an announcement on Tuesday, the central government has made it mandatory, effective from June 1, 2021, for all gold jewelry and artifacts to have hallmarks.
